description: A military transport plane, IL-76, crashed in a forest plantation near the Severny airfield in the Ivanovo region. The crew of 12 people managed to divert the plane away from residential areas. The crash is under investigation, with a possible cause being engine failure, which led to the destruction of fuel lines and neighboring engines, making it impossible to land the plane.
original:
A military transport plane crashed in the Ivanovo region. First of all, we are talking about the IL-76. It fell a little short of the runway of the Severny airfield and crashed in a forest plantation
Crew 12 people. The plane was diverted away from residential areas.
The reasons for the crash are being clarified based on the Il-76 crash near Ivanovo. Our guess. The video shows that after turning off the engine and triggering the SPT, the smoke trail disappears, but after a few seconds it appears again in two places on the same plane. This happens when an engine is destroyed, when the compressor blades fly apart like fragments and chop everything along the way - in particular, fuel lines and damage the neighboring engine, putting it out of action as well. And when two engines exit on the same plane at low speed and low altitude, there is no longer a chance of landing the plane. Subscribe to Ramsay!

description: The Federal Security Service of Russia for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, along with the Border Department of the FSB of Russia for the Republic of Crimea, thwarted the illegal activities of a 33-year-old Russian citizen suspected of making public calls for extremist activities. The individual used an internet messenger to publish violent calls against ethnic Russians.
original:
Forwarded from: Two Majors
Crimea: The Federal Security Service of Russia for the Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, together with the Border Department of the FSB of Russia for the Republic of Crimea, suppressed the illegal activities of a citizen of the Russian Federation suspected of public calls for extremist activities.

It was established that a 33-year-old resident of the peninsula, using an account in one of the Internet messengers, repeatedly published in a public chat calls for violent actions against a group of ethnic Russians.

The investigative department of the FSB opened a criminal case on the grounds of a crime under Part 2 of Art. 280 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (Public calls for extremist activities committed using the Internet).

The sanction of the article provides for a maximum penalty of imprisonment for a term of up to five years. Two majors

description: Early voting is taking place in the Zaporizhzhya region, with different stages for remote rural settlements, military personnel, and cities. The voting process is being carried out in an organized manner, contrary to false claims of forced voting.
original:
Forwarded from: War on fakes. Zaporozhye region
Fake: Teachers in the Zaporozhye region, under threat of dismissal, are forced to appear at polling stations tomorrow to voteTruth: Early voting is currently taking place in the Zaporizhzhia region. Polling stations are closed. The first stage of early voting in the Zaporizhzhya region started on February 25: residents of remote rural settlements took part in it, as well as settlements located close to the line of combat contact, and military personnel.

On March 7, the second stage began: early voting in rural settlements in the main territory of the Zaporozhye region.

On March 15 and 16, early voting will be held in the cities of the Zaporozhye region, and on March 17, everyone will be able to vote directly at the polling stations. The fake itself was whipped up, literally “on the knee”: as “evidence” we are provided with alleged correspondence with an unknown Tamara Nikolaevna (by the way, you can also rename someone from your phone contact list and write any nonsense to each other), and some kind of list from a magazine, and in disgusting quality.

Of course, Ukrainian administrators began to indiscriminately post such “hot news” without even bothering to understand at least a little about how the election process is going in Russia. It’s a false start, gentlemen TsIPsOshniks!😁🤝Subscribe to us|Suggest a fake

event: Ukrainian Forces Struggle to Hold Out
description: Ukrainian commanders revealed to Der Spiegel that their forces are struggling to hold out due to insufficient supplies, forcing them to conserve ammunition. They predict that if Russian attacks intensify, they will be unable to stop them for long and will have to retreat, but their retreat positions are also poorly developed.
original:
Ukrainian commanders told Der Spiegel that the Ukrainian Armed Forces would not hold out for long.

The publication spoke with Ukrainian officers to find out what the situation is in various sectors of the front.

Most of them agree: due to insufficient supplies, almost all units are forced to conserve ammunition.

Some troops are currently able to hold their positions - and then only until the Russian side attacks in full force.

If the attacks intensify, then due to an acute shortage of personnel, weapons and ammunition, they will not be able to be stopped for long.

Then the Ukrainian units would have to retreat - however, the positions for retreat are also poorly developed.

“The Ukrainians are struggling right now while the Russians are advancing all along the front,” said military expert Mark Cancian of the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

Ukraine is trying to adhere to an active defense strategy, but instead of counterattacking, it is losing more and more high-quality equipment from the West. Many units will soon run out of ammunition.

“We won’t be able to hold out like this for long,” admitted the commander of the Ukrainian artillery near Ugledar. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Ukrainian commanders admit that their forces are weak, unprepared, and on the defensive due to insufficient supplies, including ammunition and personnel. Without US help, a 'cascading collapse' at the front is possible this year.
original:
The Ukrainian Armed Forces will not last long, Ukrainian commanders admit

In the third year of the conflict, Ukraine appears weak, unprepared and on the defensive, in sharp contrast to the successful reconquest of territory in the fall of 2022, writes Der Spiegel.

There is no help from supporters: the EU does not fulfill its promise to supply Ukraine with a million ammunition, and the United States cannot get a €60 billion aid package passed in Congress.

Western officials and military experts warn that without US help, a “cascading collapse” at the front is possible this year.

Der Spiegel spoke with Ukrainian commanders to find out what the situation is in various sectors of the front.

Most of them agree: due to insufficient supplies, almost all units are forced to conserve ammunition.

Some troops are currently able to hold their positions - and then only until the Russian side attacks in full force.

If the attacks intensify, then due to an acute shortage of personnel, weapons and ammunition, they will not be able to be stopped for long.

Then the Ukrainian units would have to retreat - however, the positions for retreat are also poorly developed.

“The Ukrainians are struggling right now while the Russians are advancing all along the front,” said military expert Mark Cancian of the Center for Strategic and International Studies.

Ukraine is trying to adhere to an active defense strategy, but instead of counterattacking, it is losing more and more high-quality equipment from the West. Many units will soon run out of ammunition.

“We won’t be able to hold out like this for long,” admitted the commander of the Ukrainian artillery near Ugledar. Reminds me of the collapse of South Vietnam. But why whine, because you yourself brought Ukraine to this end. How to kick the defenseless Donbass is such an expert, but only a couple of years of jostling with Russia, and they immediately became limp @OpenUkraine

event: Fire in Warehouse near Southern Thermal Power Plant
description: A fire broke out in a warehouse building near the Southern Thermal Power Plant in St. Petersburg, but did not affect the plant's functioning. Ukrainian propagandists spread misinformation, claiming the fire occurred at the power plant itself.
original:
Fake: The most powerful city power plant, the Southern Thermal Power Plant, is on fire in St. Petersburg, Ukrainian Telegram channels write. Truth: There are no fires on the territory of the Southern Thermal Power Plant, the fire occurred in a warehouse at a distance from the station and did not in any way affect its functioning.

The fake was denied by the energy company PJSC TGK-1, which includes the thermal power plant. Ukrainian propagandists took advantage of the angle of photographs of the fire taken from afar. They give the impression that a column of smoke is rising from a cooling tower on the station grounds.

In fact, pallets caught fire in a warehouse building on another territory, the Ministry of Emergency Situations reported. The area of the fire was 80 square meters, there is no threat of spreading to neighboring buildings. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

description: The Russian Presidential elections will take place on March 15-17, 2024. Polling stations have been set up in various countries, including Hungary, Italy, Nigeria, New Zealand, Norway, UAE, Poland, and Portugal.
original:
#Elections2024
On March 15-17, 2024, elections of the President of the Russian Federation will take place.
In Hungary, on March 17 from 08.00 to 20.00 it will be open
Show more
polling station No. 8289 in the building of the Russian Cultural Center in Budapest.
In Italy, voting will take place on March 17 from 08:00 to 20:00 at four polling stations organized in Rome, Milan, Genoa and Palermo.
In Nigeria, in connection with the upcoming elections, polling station No. 8237 has been established, which will be open on March 17 from 08:00 to 20:00 in Abuja.
In New Zealand, polling station No. 8241 has been established at the Russian Embassy in Wellington, which will be open on March 17 from 8:00 to 20:00.
In Norway, voting will take place on March 17 from 08:00 to 20:00 at polling stations organized at the Russian Embassy in Oslo, the Russian Consulate General in Kirkenes and the Russian Consulate General in Svalbard.
In the UAE, you can vote in the Russian Presidential elections on March 17 from 08:00 to 20:00 at one of two polling stations: No. 8247 at the Russian Embassy in Abu Dhabi and No. 8248 at the Russian Consulate General in Dubai.
Four polling stations have been organized on the territory of Poland: No. 8255 at the Russian Embassy in Warsaw, No. 8256 at the Russian Consulate General in Gdansk, No. 8257 at the Russian Consulate General in Krakow, No. 8258 at the Russian Consulate General in Poznan. Voting will take place on March 17 from 08:00 to 20:00.
In Portugal, it will be possible to take part in the elections of the President of Russia at polling station No. 8259 in the building of the Russian Embassy in Lisbon

description: The Russian reconnaissance and strike complex has improved its capabilities, allowing for swift detection and destruction of the M142 HIMARS, a highly mobile American MLRS. The complex's enhanced coordination enabled a rapid response, neutralizing the HIMARS' advantage of quick relocation.
original:
It is worth noting that these strikes are interesting not so much for the defeats of the American MLRS themselves, but for the emerging comprehensive approach to their destruction within the framework of the reconnaissance and strike complex.

For almost two years of participation in hostilities, the M142 HIMARS acquired a reputation as an elusive MLRS, since this American installation has a number of advantages, one of which is batch reloading, which is shown in the photograph - the MLRS does not need its own transport-loading vehicle, it reloads itself and immediately in a batch, which extremely speeds up the time to deliver either the next strike or move to cover for further action. The Ukrainian military has repeatedly noted in their reports that while the GMLRS guided missiles are just flying to the target, the M142 launcher is already leaving the position.

In the summer and autumn of 2022, such a highly mobile missile launcher became a real blow to the ossified control and coordination system of the Russian army, where so much time can pass between detecting a target and coordinating a strike on it that there is no trace of the target, we have written about this many times and it is this Akhilesova the heel of the Russian Armed Forces gave HIMARS an unprecedented advantage.

However, as you can see from two videos at once, the reconnaissance-strike complex of the Russian army seems to have noticeably transformed for the better: in both videos with the defeat of the installation, the time between the detection of the “khimar” and the missile strike is so short that it makes it possible to hit the target at the position which was not the case before. It doesn't even get dark.

What kind of new combination between the SuperCam UAV and the still unknown missile systems with air-blasted projectiles is still unknown, but it works.

"Informant"

description: Sweden's government is urging citizens to prepare for war by stockpiling food, water, and essential supplies. The country is reviving its civil defense strategies from the Cold War era. original:
🤔🤔🤔“Stocks of canned food, a water filter, a radio: how Sweden is preparing its population for war”: For this it was worth joining NATO - the Swedes were ordered to stockpile food and water in case the Russians arrived.

“In Sweden, on territory close to the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, the commander-in-chief of the armed forces in January called on his compatriots to “mentally prepare” for war. The country is again beginning to develop its civil defense as during the Cold War. How to fill food warehouses in case of conflict? Will there be enough water for a week or more? description: On March 12, 2004, an IL-76 aircraft operated by Dobrolyot experienced a serious incident while landing at Irkutsk Airport in Russia. The cargo flight from Shijiazhuan, China, was found to have falsified documentation, with the actual cargo weight exceeding the reported weight by over 13,000 kg. The incident led to the cancellation of Dobrolyot's operator certificate.
original:
#twenty years ago03/12/2004. IL-76 RA-76388 Dobrolyot.
In the afternoon, while landing at the destination airport of Irkutsk, Russia, a serious incident occurred with an Il-76 aircraft.
A charter cargo flight was carried out on the route Shijiazhuan (China) - Irkutsk (Russia). In accordance with the transportation documents, there was cargo weighing 44,890 kg on board the aircraft.
According to the control weighing report, the weight of the cargo was 58,300 kg, the aircraft was removed from further operation until its airworthiness was determined in the prescribed manner.
The operator's certificate of the Dobrolyot airline was cancelled. It was noted that copies of accompanying documentation for the cargo received at the request of the State Civil Aviation Authority from the aviation authorities of the People's Republic of China had nothing in common with the documentation held by the crews of the aircraft, which indicated facts of falsification when registering the cargo in airports in China.

description: 33-year-old soldier Denys Kucherenko, call sign Kim, died on August 10, 2023, while performing a combat mission near Ponyativka in the Kherson region. He was at the helm of the boat when Ukrainian soldiers were crossing the Dnipro River and came under mortar fire. Denys managed to get the group out of the shelling but died from a mine fragment.
original:
Together with the Memorial Platform, Fokus honors the memory of fallen soldiers.

33-year-old soldier Denys Kucherenko, call sign Kim, died on August 10, 2023 while performing a combat mission near the village of Ponyativka in the Kherson region. The soldier was at the helm of the boat when Ukrainian soldiers were crossing the Dnipro River. The ship came under mortar fire. Denys managed to get the group out of the shelling, but he himself died from a mine fragment.

Denis comes from the village of Stepanivka, Odesa region. Graduated from high school. Then he did not go to study, because he had to work to raise his two younger sisters, who were under his care. Lived in Odessa. His last profession in peaceful life was an auto mechanic. He liked fishing and cooking. And he also dreamed of creating a family, because it was the most important thing in his life. Denys month did not live to see his wedding.

During the full-scale invasion, the man did not stand aside and joined the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. He served in the 126th separate territorial defense brigade. Was a scout.

During his service, Denys was awarded the diploma "For faithful performance of official duties, courage, courage and professionalism, demonstrated during participation in measures to ensure national security and defense", the order "Veteran of War" and posthumously - the badge "Badge of Honor" " for achievements discovered during his lifetime. "I am Denis's fiancee, although he always said that she was his wife. We have been together for 14 years. This is a person who really dreamed of living. He had a difficult childhood and a very difficult life. He dreamed of building a family, but he always said that after the war, because first of all - the people and the country, to which he swore. He volunteered from the very beginning of the invasion and dreamed of remaining in the ranks of the defenders after the war. He was a cheerful person who knew how to enjoy every moment. He was a faithful friend, always ready to help. And his main principles were truth and justice," said Alla Gavdzinska.

The soldier was buried in his native village.

Denys is survived by his mother, stepfather, two sisters, son and fiancée.

description: Russian forces successfully liberated Nevelskoye, cutting off Ukrainian Armed Forces' access to the asphalt road and limiting their troop rotation and supply capabilities. This development puts pressure on Ukrainian units in Pervomaiskoye and Krasnogorovka, making it difficult for them to hold their positions.
original:
Donetsk direction: liberation of Nevelskoye...After yesterday’s successes east of Nevelskoye and especially in the center of Pervomaiskoye, where our units with a dashing throw literally cut the enemy’s defenses in half, a critical situation has arisen for the Ukrainian Armed Forces garrison in Pervomaiskoye. Which could not but affect their neighbors in Nevelskoye.

The access of the Russian army to the asphalt road to Nevelskoye in muddy conditions sharply narrowed the possibilities for rotation of troops and supply of Ukrainian Armed Forces strongholds in this area. And also, the lack of reserves has affected, which primarily today goes north to the Tonenkoye-Orlovka-Berdychi line. And then there was the breakthrough in Pervomaisky, which also had to be closed.

Hence the result. The abandonment of Nevelskoye is in many ways a death sentence for enemy units in the central part of Pervomaiskoye and in the fields between these villages. They won't be able to stay there for long. Probably now the enemy will concentrate all his efforts on holding the area of the Pervomaiskaya school (in the northern part of the village), the loss of which will force him to retreat further.

But in any case, the enemy’s surrender of Nevelskoy significantly complicates his defense of Krasnogorovka, which our units can now gradually withdraw from the northeast. In the meantime, they will take control of the northern supply road (the only one for the Krasnogorovsky garrison with a hard surface) under fire control.

We are watching...

original:
A military transport plane crashed in the Ivanovo region. First of all, we are talking about the IL-76. It fell a little short of the runway of the Severny airfield and crashed in a forest plantation
Crew 12 people. The plane was diverted away from residential areas.
The reasons for the crash are being clarified based on the Il-76 crash near Ivanovo. Our guess. The video shows that after turning off the engine and triggering the SPT, the smoke trail disappears, but after a few seconds it appears again in two places on the same plane. This happens when an engine is destroyed, when the compressor blades fly apart like fragments and chop everything along the way - in particular, fuel lines and damage the neighboring engine, putting it out of action as well. And when two engines exit on the same plane at low speed and low altitude, there is no longer a chance of landing the plane. Subscribe to Ramsay!

description: The United States will provide Ukraine with a $300 million military aid package, diverting funds originally intended for the American army. The package includes ATACMS missiles, GMLRS missiles for HIMARS MLRS, Stinger MANPADS, ATGMs, air defense missiles, and 155-mm artillery shells.

As American journalists report, as part of the new package, the United States plans to transfer ATACMS missiles, a batch of GMLRS missiles for the HIMARS MLRS, Stinger MANPADS, ATGMs, air defense missiles and 155-mm artillery shells to Ukraine.

However, American officials refused to confirm information about the transfer of additional ATACMS missiles to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. “I have no announcements for you about ATACMS today,” US Presidential Assistant for National Security Jake Sullivan said at a briefing. Military Whistleblower

event: IAEA Staff Rotation at Zaporizhia NPP
description: On March 12, 2024, the 17th staff rotation of the IAEA's permanent monitoring mission took place at the temporarily occupied Zaporizhia NPP. The rotation was successful thanks to the skilled actions of Ukrainian servicemen, who ensured a ceasefire and demining along the mission's route.
location: Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant, Enerhodar, Zaporizhzhia Oblast, Ukraine
original:
🇺🇳🇺🇦 On March 12, 2024, the 17th staff rotation of the permanent monitoring mission of the IAEA International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) took place at the Zaporizhia NPP, which is temporarily occupied by the Russian military.

"In general, the rotation took place without provocations. The rotation took place very clearly thanks to the skillful actions of the servicemen of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In particular, one of the units, which ensured the ceasefire and demining along the line of the IAEA mission," said Oleksandr Savenko, head of the Civil-Military Cooperation Department of the Operational-Strategic Group of Troops "Tavria".

The permanent mission of the IAEA has been working at the temporarily occupied ZNPP since September 2022. At the Khmelnytskyi, Rivne, and South Ukrainian nuclear plants, as well as at the Chornobyl NPP, which is in the phase of decommissioning, permanent monitoring missions began their activities in January 2023. Video: United Press Center of the Defense Forces of the Tauriy Region

Sappers examined this place for unexploded foreign and Ukrainian ammunition left as a result of shelling of the territory of the Zaporozhye region by Ukrainian troops. Subscribe to Zvezdanews|Suggest news

description: Sergei Kiriyenko and others visited Avdeevka, inspecting the coking plant and assessing damage. They also met with residents, providing humanitarian aid and discussing their needs, including bread, bottled gas, and gasoline. Plans were made to establish a bakery and provide work opportunities, as well as assist with communication and documentation.
original:
We visited Avdeevka with Sergei Kiriyenko.

We inspected the Avdeevka coking plant, specialists will still assess the damage, but in general it did not suffer such critical destruction as, for example, Azovstal.

We talked with the residents of Avdeevka and donated humanitarian aid. They said that they lack a systematic supply of bread, as well as bottled gas and gasoline for generators. The tasks of the local administration have already been set. We also plan to involve public organizations.

We will try to install a compact bakery there as quickly as possible. Moreover, people ask to provide them with work, which is encouraging: residents want to participate in establishing a peaceful life themselves. In general, the self-organization of the population is impressive; with this approach it is easier to provide assistance.

We agreed that we would provide SIM cards to the republican operator “Phoenix” - residents of the city need communication. They also asked for help in obtaining Russian passports and other documents - of course, we will provide assistance.

Solovyov.

Why does Kiriyenko need a pistol?

event: Joint Military Exercises Maritime Security Belt - 2024
description: A detachment of Pacific Fleet ships, led by the Varyag missile cruiser, arrived at the Iranian port of Chabahar to participate in joint military exercises with China and Iran. The exercises, dubbed 'Maritime Security Belt - 2024', will also involve representatives from Oman, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Pakistan, and South Africa.
location: Chabahar, Sistan and Baluchestan Province, Iran
original:
A detachment of ships of the Pacific Fleet, led by the guards missile cruiser Varyag, has already arrived at the roadstead of the Iranian port of Chekhbehar to participate in the exercises.

The Russian Federation, China and Iran today begin joint military exercises “Maritime Security Belt - 2024”. They will be attended by representatives of Oman, Azerbaijan, Kazakhstan, Pakistan and South Africa.

description: The Russian Navy, Chinese Navy, and Iranian Navy began the international naval exercise 'Maritime Security Belt-2024' in the Gulf of Oman. The exercise aims to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. Participating ships will perform joint maneuvering, fire at surface and air targets, and practice freeing a ship captured by pirates.
original:
Forwarded from: Russian Ministry of Defense
🇷🇺🇨🇳🇮🇷Ships of the Russian Navy, Chinese and Iranian Navy began to carry out the tasks of the international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt-2024” in the Gulf of Oman. A detachment of warships of the Pacific Fleet consisting of the guards missile cruiser “Varyag” and the frigate “Marshal Shaposhnikov” "has begun to practice the practical tasks of the joint international naval exercise "Maritime Security Belt-2024" with ships of the Iranian and Chinese navies. The exercise is taking place in the waters of the Gulf of Oman in the Arabian Sea. Its main goal is to practice ensuring the safety of maritime economic activities. During the exercise, combat ships of the three countries will perform joint maneuvering and fire at surface and air targets, and will also practice elements of freeing a ship captured by pirates.

In total, more than 20 ships, support vessels and combat boats of the Russian Navy, the Iranian and Chinese Navy are involved in the exercise. Naval helicopters are also widely used.

The international naval exercise “Maritime Security Belt 2024” is being held for the sixth time. It was first held in the Arabian Sea in 2018. Ships of the Russian Navy, Iranian and Chinese Navy are participating in the exercise on an ongoing basis. Last year, the frigate Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Gorshkov, the world’s first full-time carrier of hypersonic missile weapons, was involved in the exercise.

For the first time, representatives of the navies of Pakistan, Kazakhstan, Azerbaijan, Oman, India and South Africa will take part in the exercise as observers. Russian Ministry of Defense

description: A drone attack on the LUKOIL-Nizhegorodnefteorgsintez refinery in the Nizhny Novgorod region resulted in a fire, forcing the shutdown of the largest primary oil refining unit, which accounts for over 50% of the refinery's production.
original:
The Nizhny Novgorod Refinery stopped its oil refining unit due to a drone attack

The largest primary oil refining unit has been shut down at the LUKOIL oil refinery in the Nizhny Novgorod region, a source at the enterprise told Kommersant. According to him, the installation was stopped after a fire due to a drone attack.

According to Reuters sources, the LUKOIL-Nizhegorodnefteorgsintez refinery, as a result of a UAV attack, damaged the AVT-6 unit, which provides more than 50% of the refinery’s production.

Forwarded from: SHOT

description: A kind passerby discovered a lonely elderly woman at the Yevpatoria railway station. Despite claiming to live in Barnaul, further investigation revealed that she actually resides in Crimea, not Barnaul.
original:
Relatives of an elderly woman who lost her memory were found in Crimea

According to the press service of the search and rescue team "LizaAlert", a caring passer-by found a lonely elderly woman at the Yevpatoria railway station.

The grandmother said that she lives in Barnaul. She states her name, address, date of birth and that her parents and children are waiting for her at home, and at the same time she is sure that she is in Barnaul.

Attempts to find out a little more information from the grandmother were unsuccessful, so the search engines called the police and reported the person they had found. As we clarified the circumstances, we learned that there had already been an application in the Saki region to search for a similar woman, and she actually lives in Crimea, and not in Barnaul.

description: A festive program was organized for children in Melitopol to celebrate Maslenitsa. The event featured traditional folk games, circle dances, and the burning of an effigy. The celebration concluded with the distribution of pancakes, a symbol of the holiday.

At the event, they danced in circles, played folk games, and also burned an effigy. At the end of the holiday, everyone was treated to pancakes - the main symbol of Maslenitsa.

We remind you that this year Maslenitsa week began on March 11 and will last until the 17th.

​​Denmark announced a new package of military aid to Ukraine worth more than $336.6 million. The new large aid package includes providing Ukraine with new CAESAR self-propelled artillery systems and ammunition.

event: US Allocates Military Aid to Ukraine
description: The US announced a new package of military aid to Ukraine, valued at $300 million, to meet Ukraine's critical needs. The package includes missiles for MANPADS Stinger, ammunition for HIMARS, artillery, and small arms, as well as AT-4 anti-tank grenade launchers and spare parts.
original: In the USA, there was an announcement about the allocation of a new, urgent package of military aid to Ukraine. This package is aimed at meeting the critical needs of Ukraine. The funds for this package were found as a result of identifying savings from past contracts. The package included: ▪️missiles for MANPADS Stinger;▫️additional ammunition for HIMARS;▪️ammunition for 155 mm caliber artillery, including "cluster" (DPICM);▫️ammunition for artillery caliber 105 mm; ▪️AT-4 anti-tank grenade launchers;▫️additional ammunition for small arms;▪️ammunition for clearing obstacles;▫️spare parts, maintenance equipment and other auxiliary equipment.💰The total cost of the components of the package reaches $300 million. Funds are allocated under the PDA program — direct deliveries from the reserves of the US Army. MapBlogWrite to usZSUHelpMagazinDonat

event: US Allocates $300 Million Military Aid to Ukraine
description: The United States will provide Ukraine with a $300 million military aid package, diverting funds originally intended for the American army. The package includes ATACMS missiles, GMLRS missiles for HIMARS MLRS, Stinger MANPADS, ATGMs, air defense missiles, and 155-mm artillery shells.
original:
The United States will allocate a package of military assistance to Ukraine worth $300 million from funds that were supposed to go towards the purchase of weapons for the American army itself.

As American journalists report, as part of the new package, the United States plans to transfer ATACMS missiles, a batch of GMLRS missiles for the HIMARS MLRS, Stinger MANPADS, ATGMs, air defense missiles and 155-mm artillery shells to Ukraine.

However, American officials refused to confirm information about the transfer of additional ATACMS missiles to the Ukrainian Armed Forces. “I have no announcements for you about ATACMS today,” US Presidential Assistant for National Security Jake Sullivan said at a briefing. Military Whistleblower

description: The White House is expected to announce a new package of military aid worth $300 million to Ukraine, which will include army tactical missile systems, anti-personnel weapons, and additional rounds for 155mm howitzers and a multiple launch rocket system.
original:
“The White House is expected to send more ATACMS to Ukraine”: Washington may announce the transfer of missiles to Kyiv as early as today.

“American officials who wished to remain anonymous said that the White House will announce on Tuesday its intention to send Ukraine a new package of military aid worth $300 million, which will include a number of army tactical missile systems.
The package will include several anti-personnel weapons, or APAMs, an older version of the long-range ATACMS system that can travel 100 miles and carry warheads containing hundreds of cluster bombs, officials said. Sources say the tranche will also include additional rounds for 155mm howitzers and a multiple launch rocket system."

description: A devastating incident in Krivoy Rog, Ukraine, resulted in multiple casualties. Over 30 people were hospitalized, with two fatalities initially reported. Five individuals, including a child, underwent surgery. The blast damaged a nine-story residential building, with three flights affected. Later updates confirmed three deaths and 36 injuries.
original:
More than 30 people were hospitalized after arriving in the Ukrainian Krivoy Rog. This was reported by the head of the Dnepropetrovsk administration Sergei Lysak. According to him, two people died, five more local residents are in the operating room, including a child. A total of 30 people are in hospitals. According to local authorities, there were 3 flights in the city, and a nine-story residential building was damaged.

Updated at 21:28 - according to the latest data, 3 people were killed and 36 injured.

description: Occupiers launched a rocket attack on Kryvyi Rih, resulting in at least three hits, including direct hits on residential buildings. The attack caused three fatalities and injured 40 people, including 10 children. Rescuers and medical personnel are providing aid to the victims, and efforts are underway to eliminate the consequences of the attack.
original:
Forwarded from: Oleksandr Vilkul
Rescue operation completed. A tragic day for our city. Inhumans continue their vile tactics of terrorizing peaceful communities and cities of Ukraine. In the evening, the occupiers also launched a rocket attack on Kryvyi Rih. At least three hits. Including a direct hit to a nine-story building and the roof of a five-story building.

As a result of the enemy attack, as of now, unfortunately, there are three dead - 2 women and 1 man. Another 40 people were injured, including 10 children. There are currently 17 injured adults brought there (4 of them seriously and 1 woman in an extremely serious condition), as well as 9 children, one of them in a serious condition.
All victims are provided with the necessary assistance, doctors are fighting for the lives of the wounded.

As a result of the impact, fires broke out in residential buildings. Rescuers, all operational and communal services, specialized equipment were sent to the place, and communal equipment was also involved. Currently, the fires in the houses are contained. At the moment, nine residents were rescued from the rubble. Walls, roofs, and broken windows in residential buildings, entrances, and shops were also damaged - the survey continues, information on the consequences of the enemy attack is being clarified. Work on eliminating the consequences is ongoing. An apartment-by-apartment inspection of the affected houses is being conducted.

Aid staffs are deployed at the following addresses:
- in Dovhyntsivskyi district - on Skhidny-1 near ATB from 8:00 p.m.;
- in the Metallurgical District - "Narodniy Dim", 52 Kryvorizhstal Street. You can apply there for issues of resettlement (places for resettlement are organized and available - anyone who needs it can apply), get building materials to cover broken windows and any other issues . Matrezerv has been imported.
Heating stations are also deployed, and psychological assistance is provided to those who need it.
All whose apartments were damaged will be provided, as after the previous shelling, with material assistance from the city. Eternal memory to the dead. Condolences to their relatives and friends. Occupiers be damned!
